alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 4:43AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Narrow band of heavy rain and strong winds will impact portions of Passaic, northwestern Union, northwestern Bergen, northwestern Essex, northern Westchester, Orange, western Putnam and Rockland Counties through 615 AM EST... At 441 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a narrow line of heavy rainfall and a shtrong windshift along a line extending from near Breakabeen to Arrowhead Lake to near Shrewsbury. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Southerly wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, shifting to the northwest SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could knock down tree limbs and a few trees and powerlines, and will blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... West Milford around 610 AM EST. Wayne and Ringwood around 615 AM EST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this line and may lead to minor localized flooding.
